Big and great place for your health issues, just like many others, but the emergency waiting dilemma still a big concern while considering 'emergency care'.

Just had our second  baby here and all the nurses were and have been, so helpful and friendly with everything having a newborn involves. I must say that all the staff from the doctors down to the girl giving you directions as you enter where all professional and polite. I've been in many hospitals in my long life and these guys and gals can stand with any of them. Well done.

The emergency room is a joke, it's been a joke for years. Theirs so many horrific stories of negligence and just a lack of professionalism. This is not a new problem, this ER had been a disaster for 20 years. Worst ER I have ever witnessed.

dislocated my kneecap at school today, and the paramedics were great and understanding. i got taken to a room immediately, and got my knee put back into place while being put under. my only complaint is that they didnt teach me how to adjust my brace if it were to start slipping, or how to use my crutches.

I am waiting for hip replacement surgery in Calgary and required an xray. I phoned ahead and was told to walk in the following morning. After navigating large distances on a deteriorated hip, I was told to come back in 2 hours and will now have to walk even further the second time.

Despite the lacklustre reviews, my time at Chinook Regional Was really quite amazing. Was in & out in less than two hours. The nurses & Dr. Kwan were excellent. I’m really impressed with the level of care I received.

After my mother was injured the wait in the Emergency was reasonable with about 30 minutes. And they were quick to get xrays done and put a cast on her arm. The staff here were very compassionate, kind and professional. I was initially afraid to seek medical attention, but the team that helped me always went out of their way to make me feel comfortable through a tough time. If you feel like something is wrong, please let these amazing people help you!
